name: Golden Rama Hotel Microservices
details: In the Hotel Microservices project, I played a pivotal role in architecting and implementing a cutting-edge microservices solution using the Go-Gin framework. This initiative aimed to modernize and optimize various functionalities within the hotel management domain.

Tech stack:
  • Go-Gin: Leveraging the Go programming language and the Gin framework, we ensured the development of high-performance and scalable microservices. This choice facilitated rapid development, enabling us to create responsive and efficient microservices tailored for the hotel management system.
  • MySQL: The project seamlessly integrated MySQL as the relational database management system, guaranteeing robust data management, retrieval, and maintaining relational integrity for flawless hotel data operations.
  • ECR (Elastic Container Registry): Docker container images were securely stored and managed using ECR, allowing for a containerized deployment approach. This strategy improved scalability, deployment consistency, and efficiency across the microservices.
  • EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service): The microservices found their deployment on EKS, utilizing Kubernetes orchestration for automated scaling, effective load balancing, and streamlined container orchestration.

This project not only demonstrated my proficiency in the specified technologies but also showcased my ability to design and implement microservices tailored for the hotel management sector. The outcome was an innovative and scalable solution contributing to the enhancement and efficiency of hotel management operations.

name: Golden Rama Tour Microservices
details: As the driving force behind the Tour Microservices project, I spearheaded the development of a dynamic and efficient microservices architecture using the Go-Gin framework. This initiative aimed to revolutionize and streamline various functionalities within the tour management domain.

Tech stack:
  • Go-Gin: Leveraging the Go programming language and the Gin framework, we ensured the development of high-performance and scalable microservices. This choice facilitated rapid development, enabling us to create responsive and efficient microservices tailored for the hotel management system.
  • MySQL: The project seamlessly integrated MySQL as the relational database management system, guaranteeing robust data management, retrieval, and maintaining relational integrity for flawless hotel data operations.
  • ECR (Elastic Container Registry): Docker container images were securely stored and managed using ECR, allowing for a containerized deployment approach. This strategy improved scalability, deployment consistency, and efficiency across the microservices.
  • EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service): The microservices found their deployment on EKS, utilizing Kubernetes orchestration for automated scaling, effective load balancing, and streamlined container orchestration.

This project not only showcased my expertise in the specified technologies but also demonstrated my ability to architect and implement microservices tailored for the tour management sector. The result was a scalable and responsive solution contributing to an optimized and streamlined tour management system.

name: Golden Rama Flight Microservices
details: In the Flight Microservices project, I led the development and implementation of a robust and scalable microservices architecture using the Lumen 10 framework. This innovative solution was designed to streamline and enhance various aspects of the flight management system.

Tech stack:
  • Lumen 10: Leveraging the power of the Lumen 10 framework, we ensured rapid development and efficient performance in handling the complex functionalities of the microservices.
  • MySQL: The project seamlessly integrated MySQL as the relational database management system, guaranteeing robust data management, retrieval, and maintaining relational integrity for flawless hotel data operations.
  • ECR (Elastic Container Registry): Docker container images were securely stored and managed using ECR, allowing for a containerized deployment approach. This strategy improved scalability, deployment consistency, and efficiency across the microservices.
  • EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service): The microservices found their deployment on EKS, utilizing Kubernetes orchestration for automated scaling, effective load balancing, and streamlined container orchestration.

This project not only showcased my proficiency in the specified technologies but also demonstrated my ability to design and implement microservices that are both resilient and adaptable, contributing to an optimized flight management system.
